intro: Meineckia phyllanthoides subsp. capillariformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Meineckia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by distinctive bracts. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique morphology and restricted distribution make it a notable species within its native range.
